content: <asn_d6> <@552133098075193354> I will unfortunately not be able to attend that one. I think @dankrad can give all the updates on the reverse bit ordering PR and KZG client libs though!

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Cool! main question about that PR that I wanted to make sure we cover is whether we should block the next devnet on it or not.

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> I think it shouldn't be too hard to hack that PR on the clients. But if it seems like too much work, probably not worth delaying a devnet for it. It can be done on the next one.

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> right, it's both a question of implementation and also overhead of restarting things and "timing" - if the PR is merged in 3 days then it makes sense to hold off the devnet a few more days to implement it, but if we expect a week or two of back and forth on it, then probably best to wait

author: inphi
content:
With the possibly upcoming harforks for eip4844 (and withdrawals), has there been any discussion on how the upgrade will be scheduled and triggered? Either proposal affect both EL and CL at the same time and would need some coordination to avoid compatibility issues.
<@360491619402776577> drafted a PR for geth to move to a slot-based fork in EL. Is that all that'll be needed?

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> It's still TBD, and there were discussions of potentially using timestamps on the EL, but I guess that would be pretty independent of any single EIP?

author: bridge-bot
content: <inphi> Using timestamps would be the easiest to implement fwiw. With eip4844 anyways, it introduces new payloads post-fork So doing this will simplify block building interactions by alleviating the need to support multiple payload types in a beacon client.

author: timbeiko
content: That is my (non engineer) intuition as well, but <@360491619402776577> seemed to disagree!

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I implemented it just in case. We (geth) would like to go back to a blocknumber based fork system
